body:
1. Your simulation probably did not run correctly.
Check the report out of the Run Simulation component to see what severe or fatal errors happened in the simulation.
If there are no severe or fatal errors, the issue could just be that there is .eio file adjacent to the .csv _resultFileAddress.
Check the folder of the file address you are plugging into this component and make sure that there is both a .csv and .eio file in the folder. 2. No surface information was found in the imported .eio file adjacent to the .csv _resultFileAddress.Data cannot be normalized by surface area and the data tree outputs for surface data will not be grafted by zone.
topic: "Your simulation probably did not run correctly"

replies.body: Hi Davide, Please pay attention to geometry. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SAkqTdOA2dv9IORDXC1230Na5Vjt20inv*hFpimKbhmj4yJA3*cv3UUKPOhDgXx1If-92fC1q3Qv44DDa97as7sVBmXe*TUP/Capture.JPG) Such errors must be avoided.

Following are changed made in your file.

1. Non-convex surfaces addressed by breaking zones

2. consistent analysis periods provided

3. Face mating issue addressed in the middle group of zones

4. Updated components to their latest versions

5. Non-coplanar windows revised



Please find revised copies.
What do you mean by "Breaking Zones" ? I have the same Non-Convex error in a model.

Hi, Divided into 2 zones, then assign "Air walls" between to connect them by solving adjacencies. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/O-hEV24HtuYqRlZ3UQ6TWUXzDzdeKqpOXyY9Nfx*SIFI3hPSWARpdFCfJb-AdKKcZYAKBVjCoZ*3SemNAZ8TtLdY2DbNZk5U/image613.png) See [this](http://bigladdersoftware.com/epx/docs/8-7/engineering-reference/shading-module.html#solar-distribution) (solar-distribution). Omid.

To clarify:



If I create my zones from surfaces, and assign mating surfaces as Airwalls, do I still need to run the zones through solve_adjacency component?

Good one Omid! Thanks for joining in.



Hi Davide,

[This](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/energyplus-non-convex-casting-sufaces-issue) discussion will also be useful to you I believe.

Thank you so much [Devang Chauhan](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topic/listForContributor?user=3m8ut2xbfxihd)  and also thanks to [Omid Rashidi](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topic/listForContributor?user=0gp7w06zkdwrr).
The file created by Devang Chauhan let me starting the analysis, and I could get the files .idf, .bat, .rvaudit but not the files .eio and .csv. Using the program EnergyPlus (the external program, not the Grasshopper plug-in) I could get those files but I still have the two following problems: 1. Your simulation probably did not run correctly. 
Check the report out of the Run Simulation component to see what severe or fatal errors happened in the simulation. 
If there are no severe or fatal errors, the issue could just be that there is .eio file adjacent to the .csv _resultFileAddress. 
Check the folder of the file address you are plugging into this component and make sure that there is both a .csv and .eio file in the folder. 2. No surface information was found in the imported .eio file adjacent to the .csv _resultFileAddress.Data cannot be normalized by surface area and the data tree outputs for surface data will not be grafted by zone.
